title: A Look Back at the Most Beautiful Fall Weddings in Vogue
summary:
While spring and summer have always traditionally been considered the “high season” for weddings, there’s something incredibly romantic about having your nuptials in the fall, from the cooler, cozier weather to the rich color palettes and the hearty cuisine.
And with weddings in what feels like a never-ending state of flux due to the ongoing pandemic, there’s something to be said for having a small, intimate gathering during a season when spending time with family means so much.
Over the years, we’ve featured a number of autumnal weddings that offer serious inspiration.
From Joseph Altuzarra’s classic New York nuptials at the Rainbow Room Serena Williams’s fairy tale Beauty and the Beast–inspired New Orleans fête to the adventurous bridal portraits Nicole Warne (aka Gary Pepper Girl) took atop a mountain in New Zealand—they all embody a festive fall feeling.
Whether you’re planning a micro-wedding for next month or a larger party for exactly one year from now, we’ve rounded up some of the most stunning autumn weddings in Vogue for your easy reference.
